pullRequest.body:
This is an initial PR in preparation for defining vertex algebras.  The notion of `heterogeneous vertex operator` doesn't seem to appear in the literature, but it is a convenient way to simultaneously express:
1. composites of vertex operators
2. intertwining operators between modules
3. the scalar action of multivariable Laurent series, used in locality and residue products.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

One final style comment.

bors d+

One final style comment.

bors d+

I think that using a `.` in the name will make it harder to use this with dot notation as `A.the_name v`. What do you think of
```suggestion
theorem coeff_isPWOsupport (A : HetVertexOperator  R V W) (v : V) : (A v).coeff.support.IsPWO :=
```

```suggestion
  toFun := fun x =>
  { coeff := fun g => f g x
    isPWO_support' := hf x }
```

If you want, this can be abbreviated to
```suggestion
    (hf : (x : V), (Function.support (f  x)).IsPWO) : HetVertexOperator  R V W where
```

I guess `instSMul` and `instModule` are not available as names? (I didn't check.)

What do you think of `instBaseSMul` and `instBaseModule`.

I'm trying to come up with a good name that doesn't hardcode a variable name.

(Of course this is a nitpick, because it is an instance name, so hopefully nobody will ever need to refer to it.)
Minor point: heterogeneous equality is called `HEq`. What do you think of `HVertexOperator`?
That is much better.  I was unsatisfied with `Het`.

```suggestion
  toFun := fun x =>
  { coeff := fun g => f g x
    isPWO_support' := hf x }
```
